Tomato___Late_blight.description: A serious disease caused by the fungus Phytophthora infestans that affects tomatoes and potatoes.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plant material
Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, mancozeb, or copper-based compounds
Improve air circulation by proper spacing and pruning
Avoid overhead irrigation; water at the base of plants
prevention: Use drip irrigation instead of overhead watering
Apply preventative fungicide treatments during humid weather

Tomato___Early_blight.description: A fungal disease caused by Alternaria solani that affects tomato leaves, stems, and fruits.
treatment: Remove infected leaves immediately
Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper-based compounds
Ensure proper plant spacing for air circulation
Mulch around plants to prevent soil splashing onto leaves
prevention: Apply mulch to prevent soil splashing
Stake plants to improve air circulation

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: A bacterial disease that causes spots on leaves, stems, and fruits of tomatoes.
treatment: Remove infected plants and plant debris
Apply copper-based bactericides early in the season
Avoid working with plants when they're wet
Prune infected parts and disinfect tools between cuts
prevention: Space plants properly for good air circulation

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: A fungal disease that primarily affects tomato leaves in humid environments.
treatment: Improve air circulation by pruning and proper spacing
Remove and destroy infected leaves
Apply fungicides labeled for leaf mold control
Reduce humidity in greenhouses if applicable
prevention: Practice good greenhouse ventilation if applicable

Tomato___healthy.description: Your tomato plant appears healthy with no signs of disease.
prevention: Water consistently at the base of plants
Monitor for early signs of pests or disease

Apple___Apple_scab.description: A fungal disease that causes dark scab-like lesions on leaves and fruit.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or captan
Remove and destroy fallen leaves and fruit
Prune to improve air circulation
Apply lime sulfur during dormant season
prevention: Clean up fallen leaves and fruit in fall
Apply preventative fungicide sprays in spring

Apple___Black_rot.description: A fungal disease causing leaf spots and fruit rot with concentric rings.
treatment: Prune out diseased branches and cankers
Apply fungicides containing captan or thiophanate-methyl
Remove mummified fruit from trees
Improve air circulation with proper pruning
prevention: Clean up fallen fruit and leaves
Prune out dead or damaged wood
Apply dormant oil spray in late winter
Control insects that may create entry wounds

Apple___healthy.description: Your apple tree appears healthy with no signs of disease.
prevention: Apply dormant oil spray in late winter
Prune annually for shape and air circulation

healthy.description: Your plant appears healthy with no signs of disease.

Maintain proper watering and fertilization schedule
Ensure adequate sunlight and air circulation

Grape___healthy.description: A healthy grapevine free of diseases.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: A devastating disease caused by Candidatus Liberibacter spp., affecting citrus trees.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected trees
Apply systemic insecticides to control the Asian citrus psyllid
Use nutrient therapies to improve tree health

Soybean___healthy.description: A healthy soybean plant free of diseases.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: A fungal disease caused by Podosphaera xanthii or Erysiphe cichoracearum, affecting squash and other cucurbits.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing sulfur or potassium bicarbonate
Remove heavily infected leaves
Increase air circulation by proper spacing
prevention: Maintain crop health through balanced fertilization

Potato___healthy.description: A healthy potato plant free of diseases.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: A fungal disease caused by Exserohilum turcicum that affects maize leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides like azoxystrobin or propiconazole
Remove infected plant debris
Plant resistant hybrids
prevention: Rotate crops to reduce pathogen build-up
Plant at proper spacing for air circulation

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: A fungal disease caused by Septoria lycopersici that affects tomato leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or copper-based compounds
Remove and destroy infected leaves
Prune plants to improve air circulation

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: A fungal disease caused by Cercospora zeae-maydis, leading to lesions on maize leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides such as strobilurins and triazoles
Remove infected residue post-harvest
Plant resistant hybrids
prevention: Rotate crops to reduce inoculum levels
Plant at recommended densities for air circulation

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: A fungal disease caused by Diplocarpon earlianum, causing dark spots and leaf withering on strawberries.
treatment: Apply fungicides like captan or myclobutanil
Remove infected leaves
Improve air circulation through proper spacing
prevention: Maintain clean fields and remove plant debris

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: A viral disease transmitted by whiteflies, causing yellowing and curling of tomato leaves.
treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants
Use insecticides to control whitefly populations
Apply reflective mulches to repel whiteflies
prevention: Monitor and control whitefly populations regularly

Blueberry___healthy.description: A healthy blueberry bush free of diseases.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: A fungal disease caused by Podosphaera clandestina, leading to white powdery growth on cherry leaves and fruits.
treatment: Apply fungicides like sulfur or myclobutanil
Prune infected branches to improve air circulation
Remove and destroy infected leaves
prevention: Avoid overcrowding by proper tree spacing
Monitor and control humidity levels in orchards

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: A bacterial disease caused by Xanthomonas arboricola, leading to dark spots on peach leaves, fruit, and twigs.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides
Prune infected twigs and branches
Remove and destroy fallen leaves and fruit
prevention: Maintain tree health through proper fertilization

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: A fungal disease caused by Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae, affecting apple leaves and fruit.
treatment: Apply fungicides like myclobutanil or captan
Remove nearby juniper trees to break the disease cycle
Prune infected branches
prevention: Avoid planting apple trees near junipers
Monitor for signs of rust during the growing season

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: A fungal disease caused by Corynespora cassiicola, affecting tomato leaves, stems, and fruits.
treatment: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb
Remove and destroy infected plant material
Improve air circulation through proper spacing and pruning

Prune and remove infected leaves

treatment: Remove and destroy infected plant material

Improve air circulation by proper spacing and pruning

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: A fungal disease caused by Puccinia sorghi, leading to rust-colored pustules on maize leaves.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: A complex fungal disease caused by multiple pathogens, leading to black spots on grape leaves and fruit decay.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: A pest infestation caused by Tetranychus urticae, leading to yellowing and webbing on tomato leaves.

Spray leaves with water to dislodge mites
Introduce natural predators like ladybugs or predatory mites
prevention: Maintain proper plant health to reduce vulnerability
Monitor for early signs of infestation
Avoid dusty conditions in growing areas
